poem:
Title: On The Edge Of Life

Such sorrow, laced in ink,
a name, youthful -
Daniel Anjorin,
a vestige of ended anticipation.
Leaders speak, words fall as leaves,
thinly veiling the concrete -
that heartache, a pandemonium of crimson.
Light of life has ceased in youth,
echoing in hallowed halls of power,
and on humble streets ablaze with despair.
No place for such dreadful dance,
an elegy for innocence lost.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
